title: Mystery Figure Box Questions
body:
$15 for a figurine is much better than practically any other game which sells figurines, so I've been considering buying some LoL figurines.

However, one thing which I'm concerned about is, how the mystery figurines are decided. I have watched a video on these mystery boxes, and they show the character on the box, which surely means Riot can't mistakenly give you a duplicate.

1- Can you get duplicates within 1 purchase?
2- If I purchase 3 today, and then another 3 at a later time, do they track which ones I previously got to avoid giving me duplicates?
3- It mentions you can get retired/vaulted figurines. Does that mean all of the retired/vaulted figurines have stock? Or only the ones they didn't manage to sell?
4- Is there a higher chance of me getting less popular figurines which are not selling well? Or is it close to random?

As a Lunar Goddess Diana main since her release, she's really the only one I want to get from Series 2.
I just wanted to know if getting her is possible, as she is "Special Edition - In the Vault".
Warring Kingdoms Azir and Thresh are also cute, so I wouldn't mind getting them.

It would be nice if I could get someone from Riot who knows about this department to respond, otherwise others who have bought these would be good too.

replies.body:
Your best bet to get these answers is to ticket player support: https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new

I will answer what I can from my own experience though.

1. I don't believe so, as far as I know you will not get sent two of the same from the same transaction.
2. Again, I don't believe so, they likely don't track that so you may well get a duplicate this way.
3. I believe the vaulted figures have halted production entirely, so that would mean you can only get those they have leftover stock of.
4. As far as I know, yes. When the first URF figure came out it came with a random figure free, and a *lot* of people got Gragas.
